title: Ticket #5027: getaddrinfo won't look for IPv6 if IPv4 found in /etc/hosts
description:
Report from Brian B:

  • /etc/hosts specifies a.example.com maps to 1.2.3.4
  • DNS would return 1.2.3.4 and ABCD::6789
  • lookup (nsswitch.conf) was configured to use file before DNS.
  • With host based security HTCondor does forward resolution to confirm that the name maps to the IP and vice versa. It does the look up using getaddrinfo specifying AF_UNSPEC. Looking up a.example.com would only return 1.2.3.4, not ABCD::6789; it in essence stopped when it found the /etc/hosts entry. This was a pain to debug.

Is there anything we can do? Perhaps just documentation, discouraging file resolution and use of /etc/hosts/?
